io

Class FileUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.FileUtils

  • public class FileUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class with File access methods.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileUtils() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.nio.file.Path cutPathTail(java.nio.file.Path path, int tailLength)
      Removes the last N characters from the String representation of the given Path (where N is given by tailLength) and returns the new Path obtained from the truncated String.
      static java.nio.file.Path[] getFilePaths(java.nio.file.Path directoryPath)
      Returns an array containing the paths of all the files found in the directory at the given path.
      static byte[] readFile(java.nio.file.Path path)
      Reads a file to a byte array.
      static boolean writeFile(java.nio.file.Path path, byte[] data)
      Writes the whole content of a byte array into a file.
      static boolean writeFile(java.nio.file.Path path, byte[] data, int length)
      Writes a selected portion of a byte array into a file.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileUtils

        public FileUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • readFile

        public static byte[] readFile(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Reads a file to a byte array.
        Parameters:
        path - Path of the file to be read.
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the file's data, or null if the reading operation was unsuccessful.

      • writeFile

        public static boolean writeFile(java.nio.file.Path path,
                                byte[] data)
        Writes the whole content of a byte array into a file.
        Parameters:
        path - Path of the file to be written.
        data - A byte array containing the data to be written into the file.
        Returns:
        True if the writing operation was successful, false otherwise.

      • writeFile

        public static boolean writeFile(java.nio.file.Path path,
                                byte[] data,
                                int length)
        Writes a selected portion of a byte array into a file.
        Parameters:
        path - Path of the file to be written.
        data - A byte array containing the data to be written into the file.
        length - Length (in bytes) of the data to be written starting from the beginning of the given byte array (so the portion of the data that will be written is data[i], with i ranging from 0 (inclusive) to length (exclusive).
        Returns:
        Success of the writing operation.

      • cutPathTail

        public static java.nio.file.Path cutPathTail(java.nio.file.Path path,
                                             int tailLength)
        Removes the last N characters from the String representation of the given Path (where N is given by tailLength) and returns the new Path obtained from the truncated String.
        Parameters:
        path - The original Path.
        tailLength - The number of characters to cut.
        Returns:
        The resulting Path after the cutting.

      • getFilePaths

        public static java.nio.file.Path[] getFilePaths(java.nio.file.Path directoryPath)
        Returns an array containing the paths of all the files found in the directory at the given path. It is not recursive, it goes only one level deep, meaning that if the given directory contains subdirectories they will simply be ignored.
        Parameters:
        directoryPath - Path of the directory whose files' paths will be returned.
        Returns:
        Paths of the files found in the given directory.
